item.title: Cheapness
item.description: When talking about 'saving', I think a lot of people put it into the 'necessary evil' bucket. Something to be ashamed you're not quite doing enough of, or something that you're putting off a month or two. Sort of like a new years resolution to exercise more. But, in the same way that, depending on your outlook, exercise can be treadmill drudgery or a life-affirming hobby, I believe frugality can be in and of itself a source of joy and (life) - without considering the financial benefits.

item.title: Quicksort in Coq
item.description: The definition of Quicksort To begin with, here's the classic definition of quicksort in Haskell. quicksort :: [Int] -> [Int] quicksort l = case l of (x:rest) -> let (less_than_x, greater_than_x) = partition (< x) rest in quicksort less_than_x ++ [x] ++ quicksort greater_than_x [] -> [] If you've not seen this before, in prose it's saying: quicksort :: [Int] -> [Int] quicksort is a function that takes a list of integers, and returns a list of integers.
